title: (x) small sans serif gif with little to go on - Frutiger {Yves}
content:
Client wants me to edit a menu item and does not know what face was used. There is very little to go on and the type size is pretty small. Can anyone i.d. it and tell me where I can get it?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612045015im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ror_4701.gif)

 [‹ (x) "épicerie fine" upright connected script - French Script {Stephen, Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612045015/http:/typophile.com/node/19665 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Agostino invitation classical capitals - Delphian Open {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612045015/http:/typophile.com/node/19597 "Go to next forum topic")
author: totopo

comments.content: Frutiger, available everywhere where fine fonts are sold.

That’s strange. I have Frutiger and it was the first thing I tried. I ruled it out for some reason. Now I see it’s a perfect match. I feel dumb.

Can I take this one back?

Thanks Bald!
